dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is Bones' old bedroom.  The Necropolois version.  The floor, the walls, the furniture, everything in it -- form out of the wracked and twisted shapes of dead souls. This is that same version of the room we've glimpsed befo And it remains, even when the real room has burnt away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones there in the flesh, with Jeremiah on his knees.  Bo untying the heads from his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You two bitches were just meat, never had any idea smarter than getting yourself a little more.  But my brother Jaybird, here.  He was smart.  He didn't just want more.  He wanted more with compound interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones shoves the screaming severed heads through the unde wall of the Necropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For only a flashcut moment, we see the heads see coming a them - reaching for them.  Laughing at them.  The undead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time for him to collect his interest.  Jeremiah's gonna have the unique experience of seeing his reward, tasting it while he's still alive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones wraps his long arm around Jeremiah's neck in a brotherly choke hold.  Jeremiah terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl, Cinnabar, Bill and Patrick speed south by car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... see there ain't just two parts to a person.  There's three.  Body-Soul and Spirit.  The spirit lives in the blood.  It's the wanting that holds body and soul together, and sometimes, the wanting lives on.  Jimmy's blood must still be in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the place burned to the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blood is still there.  We just gotta figure out where.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In his grave there was a cloth or a dress or something.  Covered with blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My God.  My dress.  We have to find it.  And burn it.  And shut the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill and Patrick look at Pearl like she might be crazy. they see Cinnabar next to her, glaring back at them. INT. BONES' BEDROOM - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones has Jeremiah on his feet now, leading him towards t wall of the undead. Suddenly, hands shoot out of the wall, only inches away f Jeremiah's face!  He twists and turns to stay away from t but the long nails on one of the hands claw at his cheek. While hungry mouths open from the palms of hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (keeping Jeremiah out from hands' reach) I don't understand it.  You were my Man.  Since we was grasshoppas.  I always looked after you.  You had a piece of everything I had.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't want a piece of yours, I wanted my own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the hell everybody else, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones pushing Jeremiah's face towards the grasping hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait, Jimmy.  Think about it.  You woulda done the same thing if you was me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No brother.  I wouldn'ta.  I never done a man - any man.  Let alone a brother like that.  Course, as you can see, no good deed goes unfucked.  Now the question is, if the good get fucked, what we got saved up for the bad?  You about to find out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones rams Jeremiah's head (his eyes closed in fear) thro the Necropolis wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah's head inside now.  Eyes still closed, head bobb in the jelly-like base that holds what he sees when he da to open his eyes. Hideous malformed faces, genetic anomalies, the kinds of faces that wound up in side-shows in less enlightened tim All laughing and leering and glaring at Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: FULL C.U.
dialogues.text: The skin peeling away like congealed jelly.  Lupovich tri to talk to Jeremiah or to scream but nothing comes out.  Except for a hideous wobbling bubble. For a subliminal moment, Jeremiah sees a figure trapped inside the bubble.  His own figure, silently screaming to out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, Jeremiah is screaming for real as Bones has jus yanked his head back out of the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a trip, ain't it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones sounding almost sympathetic to Jeremiah.  Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This portion of the screenplay contains scenes that do no appear or occur elsewhere in the final movie.  In order t integrity of the screenplay, it has not been edited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, as they round a corner onto Blackstone, they se tendrils of an eerie greenish fog.  It seems to be emanat from the still smoking remains of Bones' house.  Or perha it is just the smoke, tinged only by the gaseous street lights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got to hurry.  We've got to shut the door.  They're getting out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then there's a shape and a thump!  The real terror of thinking your car just hit a human being. Then a face appears in the car window.  Just a homeless g shaking an angry fist at them.  Quickly, he's gone in the fog. Straining to see, Patrick stops, grabbing a flashlight fr his glove box.  They all get out.  Making their way throu the fog, glimpsing in darkened doorways, eerie shapes, perhaps more of the dead out of Necropolis.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They arrive at the back side of the ruined building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There was a storm door, to the cellar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They search frantically in the dark amongst the tall weed abandoned junk and burnt rubble.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah still with Bones, looking for a way out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What will it take?  What do you want?  Just tell me, Jimmy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aw that's easy.  I want my life back.  Can you swing that, my brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then fuck it!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a righteous fury, Bones headlocks Jeremiah again and r his head through the Necropolis wall.

dialogues.speaker: OVER JEREMIAH'S SHOULDER
dialogues.text: As he's back inside face to face with living dead mutatio with Lupovich's head coming at him, it's mouth suddenly opening to ten times its normal size, swallowing Jeremiah whole.

dialogues.speaker: BACK WITH BONES
dialogues.text: Watching with some pity as the rest of Jeremiah, his legs feet are pulled into the wall and gone.  Accompanied by t disappearing screams of the last of Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sadly) Dog eat dog, brother.  Dog eat dog.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They search for the cellar door.  The night air is shatte by a scream, at once very close and infinitely far.  Fina

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's found a chipped gray storm door.  Patrick easily kic in the rotten wood revealing a dark tunnel of stairs lead down beneath the ruins of the building into the sub-basem

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not safe down there.  The fire started down there.  The whole thing could collapse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then your father's a dead man and Jimmy Bones is gonna be around a long time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick steps down into the darkness of the cellar, his flashlight on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group stoops low as they descend the stairs.  Beneath wood supports, the dirt is reclaiming it, already a const trickle of dirty falling from between the boards. In the dim, Patrick leads them, walking through a mass of spider infested webs and, just ahead, is the sub-basement where they originally found the body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throwing debris aside, they come next through a small doo the bottom of the stairs and enter the sub-basement.  Nea is the elevator shaft, a gaping hole in the ruins - but recognizable as such.  The ceiling above them is nearly collapsed, and over most of the room, the accumulated deb and ruin from above has simply fallen through. And what remains of the ceiling is still shifting, groani coming apart. Patrick shines his flashlight down to the ground, until:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's found the hole that was Bones' hastily dug grave, bu there's nothing in it now but swarming white maggots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets down on her hands and knees as Patrick shines th light, but after a few frantic moments of digging, it's clear:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gone.  He got it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the sound of tremendous strain and creaking of wood.  And the ceiling starts to give way.  They all scra for shelter, and then it gives way completely -- complete blocking their way out.  They're trapped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all look in every direction for some glimpse of hope of a way out.  There is none.  Then they hear behind them resonant "DING!"

dialogues.speaker: TURNING
dialogues.text: Where moments before there was a gaping, ruined elevator shaft, there is now a fully functioning elevator just as was in 1979, the doors opening to them in eerie slo-mo. Pearl starts towards the open car.  The others trying to her back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's alright.  Let me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She walks closer, peering into the dark recesses of the elevator.  Maybe again a flash of visible movement inside Closer ever closer, until Pearl, almost entranced, steps And once inside, there's no one, or no thing, there.  Pea is about to tell them "It's okay..." when suddenly the do of the elevator slide-slam shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mama!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then they hear the elevator chain start to move and the elevator starts to rise.  Cinnabar screaming louder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl stands there, summoning all her courage for what sh knows she's going to have to face.  Watching the elevator arrow as it climbs to the number three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Bill beat on the door and try to pry it open. Then they try jamming jagged boards into the opening, but still to no avail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As a moment later, the car stops and the doors open onto:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Down to the last detail, exactly as it was 22 years ago, night Bones died.  Music playing (the Delfonics "Didn't I Blow Your Mind This Time...")  The only new detail are th dozens of candles romantically burning everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl feels a soft touch on the back of her neck and spin finds Jimmy right behind, almost nuzzling her.  His face hidden, though, in darkness.  Holding something in his ha behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (still with her back to him) Jimmy, you've got --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got what I want.  Turn around baby, look at me.  Look at your man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns slowly, and we don't know what to expect.  Something horrible or something beautiful. Finally, she's face to face, and it's Jimmy just as he wa 22 years ago.  All traces of the demonic are gone.  Pearl melts as the Delfonics swell, Jimmy holding her close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to do something for me, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see what he's holding: the dress.  Rotted and blood clotted and ruined.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always loved you in this dress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He holds it up for Pearl to see and from:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The dress is brand new and beautiful.  She's finally entranced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, Bill and Cinnabar have managed now to pry open t elevators outer doors.  They step inside on the soft ashe ground and look up:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The shaft goes all the way into eternity.  But along the tacked walls, they see hand and footholds put there for workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can climb out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Climb out to where?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere but here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one they start to climb, Bill first.  As they clim they become aware of light on the first floor level just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN BONES' CRIB
dialogues.text: Pearl steps into the frame to look at herself in a floor length mirror on Bones' closest door.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE MIRROR
dialogues.text: Not only the dress, but she too looks exactly as she was years ago, skin smooth as cocoa butter, eyes free from wo and pain.   Roberta Flack's "Killing Me Softly" as Jimmy takes her in arms and starts to slow dance her in the midst of all tho candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are we, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where we'll always be...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hush, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pulls her closer, closer, until her last misgivings are g Whatever purpose she came with lost in the power of havin the impossible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three still climbing handhold by handhold, knocking l dirt in each others' eyes.  Bill is just now reaching the first floor level, trying to force open the outer doors. Suddenly, an ominous sound: the chain/mechanism of the elevator as they see it starting to descend towards them. Panicking, Bill tries with all his might. As the elevator inches closer and closer -- Until Bill finally manages to get the doors open.  They a scramble to safety just as the elevator slides by them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After they catch their breath, they look up and around to find themselves --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A distorted M.C. Escher-like feel to the place.  Where up seems to be down, down up, and left is right.  Not helped behind only lit by the eerie flickering gaseous lamps outside, and the moonlight falling through the skylight. Then, slowly through the gloom, they begin to perceive th the walls are clotted and congealed, teratomic masses of distorted flesh; faces, limbs, eyes, mouths, all trapped all contorted in agony.  At first they seem to be frozen the walls, like the ruins of Herculaneum.  But then we se They are slowly writhing, moving.  Hands grasping, teeth rotted jaws widening, and worst of all, the eyes staring

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this Hell?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (gripping the gun) Or just Hell-adjacent...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ain't no Heaven.  Ain't no Hell.  There's just the world of the dead, my momma always talked about.  Like she said, the door is open, and we're seeing right through our world into this one.  We just have to remember what was really here.  And follow it.  Those stairs should take us to the second floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they approach the stairs they can hear faintly above t drone/moan of the dead, the soft music playing in Bones' crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start up the stairs into the darkness.  Patrick firs Cinnabar in between him and Bill.  Patrick still holding flashlight, but it's starting to flicker a little. More of the same horror along the stairway walls, eyes looking at them, hands caress Cinnabar's hair, another ha shooting up from the stair floor and grabbing Bill's thig Bill stabs the hand with the knife on his belt.  And the hands shoot back down.

dialogues.speaker: BACK IN BONES' CRIB
dialogues.text: The Munch-like dance of death goes on, Bones stroking the back of her neck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just like I told you this morning, I'd be stroking your neck tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl absolutely lost.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE STAIRS
dialogues.text: The three still ascending when Patrick's flashlight sudde cuts out.  Total darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A faint sound: Patrick shaking the flashlight.  Nothing b the sound of breathing, both human and non-human.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thing worked fine a minute ago.  Batteries were brand new --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then as suddenly as it went out, the flashlight comes bac on, illuminating a horrible sight: Maurice.  Standing rig there, a few feet in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice puts a finger to his lips and beckons them to fol The boys want it to be Maurice.  But Cinnabar knows bette

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not Maurice --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But with the beam of the flickering flashlight, they foll the shadowy figure up the steps. Then Maurice gets a bit to far ahead, and they can't see for a beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maurice.  Hold up, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then after a silent beat, just Maurice's hand appears bac out of the darkness, beckoning them onward.  Then the flashlight cuts out again.  They're back in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he shakes the flashlight) Okay, we're on the second floor.  I feel it.  No more steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The sound of Patrick cursing and shaking the batteries ar in the torch.  Eventually it comes on again. Up ahead, they still barely see Maurice, his back to them face in one quarter profile, leading them towards the nex flight of stairs at the end of the hall. They follow.  Closer and closer to the stairs, Maurice go eerily in and out of their vision.  The flashlight dies again. Darkness.  Patrick shakes it and it comes back quickly. just as quickly dies again!  A shake and it's lit again - just as Bill is stepping into the corner where Maurice disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: FLICKERING HORROR
dialogues.text: As the dog leaps at them from the corner, all teeth and slavering jaws!  Everyone scrambles for their lives, and flashlight falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR
dialogues.text: We see the skewed horror: as the dog tears at Bill, as hi gun skitters across the floor; as Patrick grabs the gun a fires, and we get a bit more illumination from the explod gunpowder.  But it does no good. Bill screams in terror as he's torn to pieces, and then t flashlight goes out and again, we're in Stygian darkness. The sound of Bill dying and a long silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill?!  Cinnabar?  Cinnabar?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No answer.  At first.  Finally in husky voice:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bill!  Bill?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick, he's...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.  Listen:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From somewhere comes the sound of the music from Bones' c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here, find my hand.  The stairs are right near here.  I saw them.  Let's just walk up there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Silence.  As we expect the worse, expect something else t take her hand.  But then:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pause -- the music from Bones' crib still beckons to them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.  Come on.  Don't let go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're in near total darkness as they climb the stairs, ma a bit of moonlight now coming in from the roofless third floor they're approaching.  All we can hear is their footsteps and their breathing as they walk the rest of th way up the stairs and emerge into:

dialogues.speaker: BONES' CRIB
dialogues.text: Both amazed to see Pearl as young and beautiful as Cinnab is, clinging to the dashing Jimmy dancing to the spectral sounds of some soul classic from back in the day.  Cinnab entranced by the vision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl opens her dreaming eyes and sees them, smiling and beckoning Cinnabar to come join her.  Cinnabar begins to. Patrick watches her until he hears something O.S. calling him.  It sounds a million miles away and yet right in his ear.  And it sounds like Jeremiah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Paaatrick...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This portion of the screenplay contains scenes that do no appear or occur elsewhere in the final movie.  In order t integrity of the screenplay, it has not been edited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He turns and looks at the wall -- subtly surging from ben the surface of the wall he sees flashes of faces and hand mouths twisted in torment.  He moves to the wall, drawn b the strange sight and the recurring sound...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if a million miles away) Patrick.  Help me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's coming from within the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, while Cinnabar is advancing towards her mother and father across the room -- Patrick, at the wall, tries to place his ear near it in o to hear where the voice is coming from. While Cinnabar is now within Bones' reach.  Pearl steps b to allow Jimmy to embrace Cinnabar.  They're reunited.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome home, baby girl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl watches as Bones caresses his daughter's cheek.  Patrick now close to the wall -- trying to hear the faint voice calling to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please...help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly something enormous presses out from the wall.  Patrick stumbles back as his father's head and torso pres out from the wall, stretched in straining effort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Help me.  I'm so sorry.  But please, help me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah, or what he's become embedded into the wall, his face stretched, mouth huge and hollow eyes dripping blood tears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.  Help me.  I'm scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick in anguish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It hurts.  I don't want to spend forever like this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jeremiah's arm reaches out from the wall, grasping toward Patrick, who reaches out to his father --  When suddenly with frightening speed Jeremiah grabs it, a wrenches Patrick to him, pulling Patrick flush up against wall, even starting to suck him in to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Patrick struggles and writhes and twists to get free f his father's grasp, he can see back across the room to th others.  He sees the room as it really is - he can see wh really happening. Pearl, not in a new dress, but in a horrible tattered, bl encrusted old dress, standing next to a rotting cadaver that's stroking Cinnabar's cheek and holding her close... Jeremiah pulling Patrick into the wall, into the Necropol itself.  Patrick, though, just as concerned with Cinnabar with himself, yelling at her across the crib.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnabar!  Stop!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Cinnabar doesn't even turn her head.  She just steps her father's embrace.  But Pearl does seem to hear someth She looks back at Patrick, beneath the illusion of the ro she sees him being pulled into the awful wall, and can he him more clearly now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No!  Cinnabar, no!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly, Pearl turns and looks into the mirror and she get full-length view of herself: a woman in ruined tatters of old, rotted dress. Then, coming into her view in the mirror is her only daug -- dancing with a decayed corpse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Noooooo!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pearl whirls and rips Cinnabar away from Bones, who at fi sort of chuckles to himself.  But he stops laughing when Pearl grabs the nearest candle and presses the flame to h breast.  In a terrible whoosh, the dried old dress and Pe are engulfed in flames.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NOOOOOOOOOO!!!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bones runs to Pearl and throws his arms around her, tryin smother the flames any way he can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Patrick and Cinnabar) Get out!!!  Go!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnabar in a shattered daze on the floor, sees her mothe flames. Patrick desperately tries to escape his father's death gr Finally, with horrible sound, Patrick wrestles free from wall, and from his father. He lurches free from them and makes it over to Cinnabar a drags her out the door just as the room dissolves around them.  As the flames destroy the dress and the last vesti of Bones' blood on it, the room begins to turn to ash. An eerie wind from nowhere begins to howl, blowing the as and smoke from the dress and from the dissolving walls. Cinnabar taking one last glance at the funeral pyre that her mother and Bones now, too, sees them almost lost in a shroud of flame and ash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick and Cinnabar run down the corridor and back down stairs, the moon overhead and the flames from Bones crib giving everything a flickering hellish cat. Everything behind and above them crumbling to dust.  The floor and then the stairs and all the howling bodies trap inside.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIRST FLOOR
dialogues.text: They reach the open elevator shaft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We gotta jump!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything around them rumbling and crumbling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick jumps and lands in the muddy ashes, dazed but unh

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING UP
dialogues.text: He sees Cinnabar peering over the edge in fear.  Then, be her, he can hear a low rumbling growl.  He sees Cinnabar and scream -- Ashes and falling debris then temporarily blind hen he wi his eyes and looks up, Cinnabar is gone from view.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinnabar!  Where are you!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He immediately climbs back up the shaft when he sees Cinn standing at the edge of the shaft above him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cinn!  Jump!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she jumps, landing right next to Patrick, who quickly gets her to her feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's go!!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They run out of the shaft and into the sub-basement just the elevator and shaft dissolve into ash. A hurricane wind blowing down and out of the shaft now.  Mixed with the sound of all the screaming, moaning souls the Necropolis. Patrick in a fury to live tears away the boards and debri blocking the exit.   He pulls Cinnabar out with him and they walk up the cella stairs, step into the dawn, weary, beaten down but not de

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They've made it out of the Inferno.  Like Dante said "Thu emerged again to see the stars."  No stars here, just the glorious dawn. Patrick stops, feels the new sun on his face.  Breathes c air again for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We made it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then from behind or above or somewhere we can hear what m be a low, low chuckle.  Jimmy Bones' chuckle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dog eat dog, boy.  Dog eat dog...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Patrick turns and spins in mounting horror.  There, behin him, right where Cinnabar was standing... The black dog.  It leaps right at the camera, filling the frame with huge teeth and bloody red tongue.  WE FREEZE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: END CREDITS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: back
